meanings.definition: To interview (someone) before an official interview.
meanings.sent1: The journalist preinterviewed the celebrity to prepare for the live show.
meanings.sent2: The HR manager always preinterviewed candidates to ensure a smooth hiring process.
meanings.sent3: The detective preinterviewed the suspect, but they kept changing their story.
meanings.sent4: The teacher preinterviewed the students to gauge their understanding before the test.
meanings.sent5: The researcher preinterviewed the participants to gather preliminary data for the study.

meanings.definition: Having been interviewed before an official interview.
meanings.sent1: The preinterviewed candidate seemed more confident during the actual interview.
meanings.sent2: The preinterviewed applicants had a better grasp of the company's expectations.
meanings.sent3: The preinterviewed actor accidentally revealed the plot twist during the audition.
meanings.sent4: The preinterviewed students aced the test due to their prior preparation.
meanings.sent5: The preinterviewed employee quickly adapted to the new role thanks to the initial discussion.
